citation.article-title: Oribaculum catoniae gen. nov., sp. nov.; Catonella morbi gen. nov., sp. nov.; Hallella seregens gen. nov., sp. nov.; Johnsonella ignava gen. nov., sp. nov.; and Dialister pneumosintes gen. nov., comb. nov., nom. rev., Anaerobic gram-negative bacilli from the human gingival crevice.

p.s: Description of Dialister (Olitsky and Gates) nom. rev.
Dialister cells are minute, obligately anaerobic, nonmotile, nonsporing, nonfermentative, gram-negative bacilli.
The major cellular constituents include C18:1cis-9 fatty acid, C16:0 fatty acid, C18:0 fatty acid, and C16:1cis-9 fatty acid (Table 2).
The type species is Dialister pneumosintes (Olitsky and Gates 1921).
